Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat\(spiralSeal\): Add SpiralSeal SS1 Sacred Tongue cryptographic encoding

Implements the complete SpiralSeal SS1 system for steganographic
encryption that transforms ciphertext into fantasy language spell-text.

New files:
- sacredTongues.ts: Six Sacred Tongue definitions \(KO, AV, RU, CA, UM, DR\)
  with 16×16 prefix/suffix grids for 256 unique tokens per tongue
- spiralSeal.ts: Full SS1 implementation including:
  - SacredTongueTokenizer: Bijective byte↔token encoding
  - SS1 format parser/formatter with domain separation
  - AES-256-GCM encryption via Web Crypto API
  - HKDF key derivation with kid-based rotation
  - Langues Weighting System integration

SS1 Format: SS1|kid=<id>|aad=<ctx>|ru:<salt>|ko:<nonce>|ca:<ct>|dr:<tag>

Section-to-tongue mapping:
- Salt → Runethic \(RU\) - historical binding
- Nonce → Kor''aelin \(KO\) - command authority
- Ciphertext → Cassisivadan \(CA\) - divine invocation
- Tag → Draumric \(DR\) - power amplification

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
